newsitem.title: UK: ML Laboratories plunges on press comment.
newsitem.headline: ML Laboratories plunges on press comment.

text.p: Shares in ML Laboratories Plc fell sharply for the second consecutive day on Tuesday amid negative press comment on the company's results yesterday, dealers said.
The shares dropped 31-1/2p to 213-1/2p by 1444 GMT in volume of 607,703 shares.
Reports in the Financial Times and the Daily Telegraph raised doubts about ML' profit prospects, despite the company's swing into profit in Monday's results.
"The results appeared fine, but they were slated by the FT and the Daily Telegraph," said one marketmaker.
The FT said "serious" profits from ML "remain some way off" while the Telegraph said it was doubtful if substantial profits would flow from a powder inhaler licensed to Medeva
ML reported a pretax profit of 5.45 million stg for the year to September 30, against a loss of 3.4 million stg, and said it had continued to make progress on product development.
